Key Match Events: Cleveland Cavaliers rallied for a 105-100 win over the Brooklyn Nets

Darius Garland scored eight of his 20 points in the fourth quarter for Cleveland, which trailed 82-68 with 35 seconds left in the third. Garland put the Cavaliers ahead for good at 97-96 with two free throws.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers failed to score 110 points for the first time, ending their NBA-record streak of doing so in 10 consecutive wins to open a season. Hall of Fame centre Wilt Chamberlain and the 1960-61 Philadelphia Warriors had held the mark with nine.
Others: Cam Johnson scored 23 points and Dennis Schroder and Cam Thomas had 22 apiece for the Nets.
James Harden had 24 points and 12 rebounds for the Clippers, Ivica Zubac had 14 points and 12 rebounds, and Norman Powell added 24 points for the Clippers.
Collin Sexton scored 23 points, Lauri Markkanen added 20 and Utah held off San Antonio, overcoming 24 points, 16 rebounds and seven blocks from Victor Wembanyama.
